The acute inflammation caused by the crystals may give rise to general signs (fever, even chills) and an acute biological inflammatory syndrome (elevated CRP, even VS, hyperleucocytosis).

If these signs are present, a joint infection must be ruled out.

However, they may also correspond to an associated infection, the classic trigger for a gout attack. This clinical picture explains the number of emergency visits and hospitalisations.

question.title: What is the primary reason for excluding septic arthritis when the patient presents with signs of acute inflammation and an acute biological inflammatory syndrome?

option_a.title: Gout attack
option_a.description: A classic trigger for septic arthritis

option_b.title: Joint infection
option_b.description: A possible cause of acute inflammation

option_c.title: Other medical condition
option_c.description: A possible alternative explanation for the symptoms

option_d.title: Gout attack and joint infection
option_d.description: Both conditions can cause similar symptoms

correct_option.title: Gout attack
correct_option.description: The primary reason for excluding septic arthritis
